## Terminology and notation

For $n$ *individuals* indexed by $i$ ($i = 1,\dots,n$), in the univariate linear regression model $y_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x_{i} + u_i,$,

-   $y$ is called the *dependent variable*, the *regressand*, or the *left-hand variable*;
-   $x$ is the *independent variable*, the *regressor*, or the *right-hand variable*;
-   $y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x$ is the *population regression line* or the *population regression function*;
-   $\beta_0$ is the *intercept* of the population regression line;
-   $\beta_1$ is the *slope* of the population regression line;
-   $u_i$ is the error term.

In vector form, this is equivalent to $Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X + U$ where

$$Y = \begin{bmatrix}
                    y_1\\ 
                    \vdots\\
                    y_n
                \end{bmatrix},
    \quad       
     X = \begin{bmatrix}
                    x_1\\ 
                    \vdots\\
                    x_n
                \end{bmatrix}
     \quad and \quad        
     U = \begin{bmatrix}
                    u_1\\ 
                    \vdots\\
                    u_n
                \end{bmatrix}$$
